author: tkstanczak
content:
> Should we then merge <@!301186049323958275>'s single txn pool PR so the EIP is up to date with the implementations?
<@!552133098075193354> I already had the single tx pool so we just need to change the config line to set the transition period to 0

author: tkstanczak
content:
> I don't think we can be sure miners will make less $ after 1559; it seems to me they'll make more dollars (less Eth).
<@!375471494081282048> I think the fee burning may be treated as taxes and the economical models usually say that introduction of taxes is being split between miners and users in a ratio dependent on the price elasticity. <@!273808422753796097> was calculating the elasticity to be around 2 recently so I think we can exactly calculate the percentage of the tax that will be absorbed by the miners (should be 60% or so of the top of my head?)

author: mohseng
content:
> <@!375471494081282048>  eth = more $
<@!748641831331561532> I think 1559 will surely drive the eth price up, and it's based on fundamentals so is a very safe bet.

author: timbeiko
content: There are a _lot_ of factors that affect the price of ETH, and crypto in general. I think it's extremely risky to assume any one change will drive price up/down and IMO we can't use this as a rationale for justifying changes to the protocol.

author: mohseng
content: I have been in the stock market since 2007 and in crypto trading since 2015.  If there are fundamental reasons for a stock to go up, it will eventually go up and technical analysis describes/predicts *how* it should get there.

author: mohseng
content: there are a lot of factors.  but someone like warren buffet invests based on fundamentals.

author: mohseng
content: eth is probably one of the few crypto assets with real fundamentals behind it.  but it can get better.

author: butta
content:
Blockchain UX is quite terrible, we already naturally burn ETH (check the burn address) , additionally incidents like the Parity bug added to that üôÇ 
...yet the price dropped 90%.

author: pipermerriam
content: I just want to voice some caution about having price related discussions in this discord.  I recognize that 1559 has an economic component and that there are legitimate price related discussions to be had in relation to it, so I'm simply raising a caution flag to ensure that any price related discussion that occurs is directly related to 1559 and is a necessary thing.

author: mohseng
content: <@!97774605351010304> keyword is eventually.  and the price fall of 90% wasn't caused based on 1 factor.  bitcoin also fell a lot.

content:
